DOC.detailed_description: Diethylstilbestrol ( DES ) , drug first synthesized 1938 , administer several million pregnant woman U.S. Europe prevention spontaneous abortion premature delivery . In 1971 , Herbst report strong association DES use pregnancy occurrence vaginal clear cell adenocarcinoma ( CCA ) expose female offspring . Animal model demonstrate range DES effect offspring exposed utero , include reproductive dysfunction , immune system change , behavioral sexual abnormality , increase various reproductive cancer male female . In mid-1970 's , several separate cohort DES-exposed daughter unexposed comparison group follow occurrence cancer , precursor lesion , reproductive effect , systematic follow-up cohort cease 1990 . In 1992 , Congress pass bill ( H ; .R . 4178 ) mandate continue follow-up DES-exposed cohort mother , daughter , son grandchildren . The National Cancer Institute , collaboration five field center , reassemble previously study cohort DES-exposed unexposed mother , daughter son , identify subject document exposure status study previously , familial link within cohort . Standardized baseline questionnaire mail cohort member ascertain risk cancer disorder . Pathology report collect report cancer preneoplastic condition . Three separate phase follow conduct . Patients Registry Research Hormonal Transplacental Carcinogenesis University Chicago add follow-up effort mail questionaire use third phase follow-up . A cohort daughter woman expose exposed DES utero add study assess effect DES third generation woman . Exposure high level endogenous estrogen utero hypothesize increase risk breast cancer DES potent estrogen . Cancer risk son also continue assess , especially increased risk prostate cancer . Since offspring expose DES utero currently reach late forty , cancer rate begin rise , important continue follow-up cohort determine long-term increase cancer risk .
